description: A variant of mantle (“cloak, robe”) now distinguished in sense.

entries.meaning: The shelf above a fireplace which may be also a structural support for the masonry of the chimney.
(climbing) A maneuver to surmount a ledge, involving pushing down on the ledge to bring up the body. Also called a mantelshelf.

verbs.description: mantel (third-person singular simple present mantels, present participle mantelling or (US) manteling, simple past and past participle mantelled or (US) manteled)

entries.meaning: (climbing) To surmount a ledge by pushing down on the ledge to bring up the body.
